ygData.subject: Re: Studded Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Woops, Sorry about that. I ve been hunting for backpack materials most of the day, so I ve got HQ s on the brain. Thanks for correcting that. Vinval ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
Woops,

Sorry about that. I've been hunting for backpack materials most of the day,
so I've got HQ's on the brain. Thanks for correcting that.

Vinval
-----Original Message-----
From: San Wong <san@...>
To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, July 19, 1999 12:05 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Studded Armor


>From: "San Wong" <san@...>
>
>Small correction. You need a medium quality pelt for studded. High quality
>is for reinforced leather which needs steel boning.
>
>Chingho Smith Tailor and Druid of Tunare
>E'ci
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Vinval <vinval@...>
>To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
>Date: Sunday, July 18, 1999 10:04 PM
>Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] Studded Armor
>
>
>>From: "Vinval" <vinval@...>
>>
>>Well, its a bit odd that you posted that question here (as studded has to
>be
>>made by a tailor), but ok.
>>
>>First the studs must be manufactured (by a smith).
>>Total supplies need for one set of studs:
>> 6 small chunks of ore
>> 1 file
>> 4 flasks of water
>>
>>Convert the small chunks into 3 metals bits, then place the bits, file and
>>your one remaining flask into the forge and prey for a success. Repeat
this
>>process until you have the required numbers of studs (ranges from 1 for
the
>>non-implemented mask to 4 or 5 for pants). Go get a High Quality Pelt
>>(wolf=small, cat=medium, bear=large), and the pattern for the item your
>>making. Place the pelt, pattern, and studs in your large sewing kit and if
>>ye gods of random number generation smile on you you'll get your piece of
>>studded (which usually has identical stats to storebought leathers). If
you
>>fail you lose it all. Kind of strange that one can ruin metal studs with a
>>needle, but there it is. -sorry for the small rant, but I practice both
>>smithing and tailoring, and would like to see at least the missing
patterns
>>implemented.- Hope that info helps.
>>
>>Vinval
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Tim Polsfoot <polsfoot@...>
>>To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
>>Date: Sunday, July 18, 1999 10:22 PM
>>Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] Studded Armor
>>
>>
